thread.title: Lyon Striker Alexandre Lacazette Reveals His Dream Club
thread.title_full: Lyon Striker Alexandre Lacazette Reveals His Dream Club

title: Lyon Striker Alexandre Lacazette Reveals His Dream Club
text:
Lyon Striker Alexandre Lacazette Reveals His Dream Club Wed Feb 08 2017 20:31:30  31:30   football 
Lyon striker Alexandre Lacazette is seeking a move away this summer as he puts Arsenal, among others, on alert but the prolific striker has named his dream club. 
And sorry Arsenal fans, it's not your club. 
The 25-year-old has claimed it would be a dream to play up front for Barcelona. 
When asked about the interest expressed by the Catalan giants, Lacazette responded by saying; 
"They're a very big club. They have aliens up front. It would be a dream." He told Canal+. 
Barca's potent attacking trident is no doubt the greatest strikeforce in football, but despite them having 'aliens', Lacazette remains hopeful he will one day grace their iconic shirt. 
" If that happens, great, but I am not here to say that I will take a place from Luis Suarez. But I would like to play for them one day." 
The Frenchman has been attracting plenty of attention with Arsenal, West Ham, PSG and Barca all reportedly keen on snapping him up. 
Though he won't come cheap. 
According to L'Equipe , Lacazette's contract, which expires in 2019, sees him have a Â£60 million release clause, which could put off potential suitors. 
Is Lacazette to Barca a good fit?
